intro: Malanea ueiensis, commonly known as the Ueiens' malanea, is a rare flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments within dense undergrowth. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
